page.title: 17RECREATION - CROYDON 1985
page.content: There are very few facilities in our area. Two swimming pools are a bus ride away but there is no sports centre near our area. The local open spaces (Wandle Park and Canterbury Park) prov- ide football and cricket pitches, but no organised teams. A few boys' foot- ball teams are attached to schools. There are Brownie, Guide and Scout troops, and a Nautical Training Centre at Kingsley School. There are two Discos, and two Cinemas in the London Road. From research we found that older people liked to spend their leisure with other elderly friends at the Bingo Hall or at "Tea Afternoons". The area has plenty of Public Houses and many of them have Dart Teams. The main centre for teenagers is the Youth Wing of Lanfranc School. There is a coffee bar, video games and various activities such as drama, music and art.
